title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.14.30 - 33 | 15-11-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: So Bhagawan can be used for all Vishnu Tattva expansions of the Supreme Lord Krishna.
segments.summary: This segment explains the Vishnu Tattva, focusing on Pradyumna and Aniruddha as expansions of Krishna and part of the Chaturvyuha.

segments.key_quote: Therefore, only a few of them are called to associate with the Lord in his transcendental pastimes as the Lord of Dwarka on this earth.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the vastness of Krishna's family in Dwarka, emphasizing the numerous sons and grandsons, and highlighting Krishna's role as the Lord of Dwarka.

segments.key_quote: So if we become connected with Krishna, we also become transcendentally situated.
segments.summary: This segment explains how connecting with Krishna elevates one to a transcendental platform, emphasizing the importance of practicing bhakti and purifying consciousness to remain in that state.

segments.key_quote: all are liberated souls, eternal associates of the Supreme Lord Kṛṣṇa.
segments.summary: This segment discusses Yudhishthira's inquiries about Krishna's associates and sons, explaining that the Yadavas and Pandavas are liberated souls and eternal associates of Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Dependence on Krishna. That is the best dependence.
segments.summary: This segment differentiates between Vishnu Tattva and Jiva Tattva, emphasizing the dependence of Jiva Tattva on Krishna for protection and the eternal servitude of liberated souls.

segments.key_quote: This dependence of the liberated soul is constitutional.
segments.summary: This segment uses the analogy of a spark and fire to illustrate the constitutional dependence of liberated souls on Krishna, warning against spiritual ignorance and the dangers of seeking independence from the Lord.
